content.div:
This week we're sporting super silky-smooth legs. Find out which shaving cream lived up to the test and which one will be tossed in the trash.



Gillette Satin Care (Suggested Retail Price: $3.99. Available at Shoppers Drugmart)

"This shaving cream was rich in texture and worked well to moisturize my skin while I shaved. It was easy to use and ensured freshly-shaven legs with no nicks. Although it had ‘no scent’ it kind of smelled like men’s shaving cream to me, which wasn’t much of a problem since the smell washed away after use. The price isn’t bad, so I would buy it – probably in a scented version though. Rating: 4/5." -Jennifer Simone

"Satin Care Pure & Delicate does a good job of lathering and you only need a small quarter-sized amount for full lower leg coverage. I used this right in the shower with wet legs and it foamed up the minute I started rubbing the gel onto my legs. Note, though, that if you store the container in your shower, the metal bottom of the can will leave a rust ring on your tub. The label says it's fragrance free for those with sensitive skin, but I could still detect a faint fragrance that smelled like men's shave cream. I had no problems getting a smooth, close shave but with other products with more feminine scents, I'm doubtful I'll be purchasing this product in the future. Rating: 3.5/5." -Bonnie Large

“I’m one of those weirdos who hardly ever uses shaving cream or anything when shaving; the water from the shower, combined with a good post-shower moisturizer, is good enough for me! As such, I don’t have much previous experience to use when rating the Satin Care Shave Gel. It certainly smelled nice and my legs did feel very soft afterwards; I didn’t notice any cuts, but then, I’ve got speed-shaving down to a science. I can say that the pre-teen science geek that lives inside of me is still delighted by the fact that the Satin Care comes out as a gel and turns into a cream. How does it do that?! Rating: 4/5” –Kat Angus


Skintimates Signature Scents - Raspberry Rain (Suggested Retail Price: $4.29. Available at Shoppers Drugmart)

"Skintimates Signature Scents in Raspberry Rain smells awesome. Fruity, floral and very feminine - my guy will not be stealing this to use on his face! You only need to use a little as the quick lather makes this gel go a long way. I don't typically use shaving cream (just regular body wash in the shower), but the added moisturizers and vitamins did not irritate my skin and left my legs and underarms feeling soft, nick free and looking smooth without leaving a residue on my skin. I didn't even need to apply a body moisturizer afterwards! Rating: 5/5." -Bonnie Large

"If you've got two X chromosomes (and legs) a bottle of Skintimate Shave Gel has likely occupied space in your shower. Just the raspberry-candy scent brings me back to the days of reading YM magazine while rocking Big Shiny Tunes 2 on my Discman (which was probably last week, come to think of it, but I digress). I have my reasons for tracking down the same bottle of Skintimate shave gel at the drug store, time and time again (apart from weird teenage nostalgia). The gel lathers thick, but shaves and rinses off neatly -- giving as smooth and close a shave as you could hope for. The bottle, I suppose, could use some tweaking; the goop tends to rocket out in larger portions than necessary. Rating: 4/5." -Leah Collins

"I'm usually the old fashioned soap and water kind of gal, but after trying the Skintimates Signature Scents in Raspberry Rain, I may be making the move to Normal People Shaving Land. Let's get the facts out of the way: not only is this shaving cream uber luxurious in both texture and moisturizing properties, but it tastes so good, you want to eat it! In fact, I did just that -- for experimental purposes, of course! While, I don't recommend eating this delectable leg treat as a meal, I can definitely say that it actually tastes good. The only thing I regret is just admitting that in public. Rating 5/5." -Miranda Furtado

entry.title: Beauty Buy or Beware: Self Tanner

link.Abstract: This week, we tackled the T of GTL and put seven sunless tanners to the test. See which ones gave us a natural glow and which ones left us looking like Oompa-Loompas.

link.Abstract: We put some popular brands of lip gloss to the test. Find out which ones shone bright – and which ones made our puckers pout.
link.title: Beauty Buy or Beware: Lip Gloss

link.Abstract: Bored by regular nail polish? With spring just around the corner, we’re looking for fun ways to jazz up our nails – without an expensive salon manicure. This week, the Dose.ca team put OPI Shatter Lacquer and Sally Hansen’s Real Nail Polish Strips to the test.
link.title: Beauty Buy or Beware: Nail Effects

link.Abstract: We try before you buy! Dose.ca editors are playing guinea pigs to get the 411 on the latest beauty products. This week, we're testing five popular brands of lipstick that promise a long-lasting perfect pout.
link.title: Buy or Beware: Long-Lasting Lip Colour

link.Abstract: We try before you buy! Dose.ca editors are playing guinea pigs to get the 411 on the latest beauty products. This week we've put five of our favourite hairspray brands to the test. Find out which one outlasted and outshined the competition.
link.title: Buy or Beware: Hairspray

link.Abstract: This week, the Dose.ca team put four face washes to the test. Find out which ones lived up to their claims and which ones fell short.
link.title: Beauty Buy or Beware: Face Wash
